name: Grilled Squid Salad

ingredient.name: small red chillies, seeded and chopped
green oakleaf lettuce, torn to pieces
green papaya, peeled and seeded, then grated or thinly sliced

method: score the inside of the squid tubes with angled cuts, turn and repeat so that the pieces form a crosshatched pattern (this is called ‘honeycombing’). Slice into bite-sized pieces.
combine fish sauce and 1 tbsp vegetable oil and marinade the squid, including tentacles, for 30 minutes.
meanwhile, heat vegetable oil and fry garlic until golden.
combine lime juice, sugar, chillies, and the fried garlic to create the dressing.
arrange witlof, baby rocket, lettuce leaves, sliced cucumber, green papaya, and herbs separately on a servingplatter.
heat a char-grill (or frying pan) and grill the squid over high heat until opaque and slightly charred, about one-two minutes on each side.
add squid to dressing and toss to combine.
serve squid immediately, accompanied by the salad platter.
